lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

Alex wants to download a file sent by his friend, Duo, but they do not know whether they have enough storage space left on their computer. Help them find the remaining space on their drive after downloading the file !
Input
Line 1 : The amount of space left on the drive containing a float and a unit separated by a space
Line 2 : The size of the downloaded file containing a float and a unit separated by a space
Output
The size left on the hard drive, expressed in the largest binary prefix based on powers of 2 (i.e. 1024 B should become 1 KiB, 1024 KiB is 1 MiB, etc...) or Not enough space if there isn't enough space to download the file.
Constraints
0 B < Sizes of the disk and file < 1024 TiB
Units can be one of : B, KiB, MiB, GiB and TiB.
If the result is not an integer, then it should be rounded down to one decimal place.
Example
Input
15 MiB
2048 KiB
Output
13 MiB
